paragraphs.text: A re-elected LNP without Campbell Newman: could this be the election that returns Queensland to normality?
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Campbell Newman's LNP government won power in 2012 in a huge landslide
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: - and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: polls suggest that most of those gains are expected to be swept away as Queensland politics returns to normality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2012, the sitting Labor government's seats in the parliament were cut savagely from 51 to seven
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The LNP opposition increased their seats from 34 to 78
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In the new parliament, there were seven government members for every member of the opposition and crossbench
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Since 2012, the LNP has lost two seats to Labor at by-elections
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: three other MPs elected for the LNP now sit on the crossbench
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Despite these changes, the LNP has a massive majority
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a large swing will be required for a change in government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Because of the huge swing in 2012, it's hard to predict which seats will be the key battlegrounds
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In a normal election campaign, you would look first at the seats held by the government by the smallest margins (those seats they came closest to losing at the previous election)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet in Queensland, most LNP seats on slim margins are seats traditionally considered to be "safe" Labor seats
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Labor has any chance of taking power
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you would expect those seats to fall easily and the election to focus on seats further along the pendulum
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At the last election, it was estimated that the LNP won 62.8% of the vote after preferences
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Recent polls indicate there has been a large swing back to Labor
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The most recent Newspoll had Labor and the LNP tied on 50% each
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: These polls suggest that Labor is in with a chance of winning the election, despite the massive number of seats they need to gain
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: In order to ward off this threat, the LNP will likely need to sacrifice many of its seats in order to focus energy on those seats they can retain
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Labor needs a uniform swing of approximately 12.5% to win the 36 extra seats they need to win a majority
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Current polling suggests that Labor is close to that number
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: this suggests that most of the seats that will be key battlegrounds are seats the LNP now holds by margins of 10-15%
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there will be seats that swing more or less than the average
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you focus on those with margins of between 10% and 15%
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: there are a smattering of seats in Brisbane, as well as four seats on the Gold Coast, one on the Sunshine Coast, one in Townsville and two rural seats near Mackay
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In addition
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the LNP will be fighting on another front against populist and right-wing independents and minor parties
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Palmer United Party and Katter's Australian Party will both be running hard
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: KAP now holds three seats
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there are four independents in the Parliament
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: While many seats will be in play
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Ashgrove in northern Brisbane - Campbell Newman's seat - is likely to be the focus of the campaign
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The premier won the seat off Kate Jones in 2012
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Newman had never held a seat in parliament before winning power in 2012
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: he made his name as lord mayor of Brisbane
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Jones had been a minister in the Bligh government, and was a high- profile target
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2012, Newman won Ashgrove with a 12.8% swing, but holds the seat by a margin of only 5.7% - half as big as the expected Labor swing
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Local polling suggests that Newman is trailing in local Ashgrove polls behind Jones
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: who is aiming to win back her former seat
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Newman is seen to be in danger of losing his seat
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: his party's campaign may struggle to answer questions about who would lead a re-elected LNP government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With Labor needing 5.7% to win Ashgrove, and 12.5% to win the overall election, it's entirely conceivable that the government could be re-elected without Newman in the lead
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That scenario may help Labor reach the vote it needs to win back power
paragraphs.label: assumption
